lines.text: It's much easier to run a hospital with all the patients sleeping.
Easiest way to run the world, for that matter.

[Pointing to brains being kept alive in glass tanks]
Do you know what that is?
Well it's got to be a brain washing machine!

What you need is some Tempodex, Jerry. That's what I'm on. Time-fix, it's my remedy for everyone. Can't you feel those millions of years waiting in your spine, huh? Waiting to find their way up into your back-brain, your mid-brain, your fore-brain? You'll never know you had so many brains, Jerry, till Tempodex starts opening them up for you.
Of course, the inevitable happened.
It frequently does.
[talking about Jenny, whom Miss Brunner had absorbed the night before]
Strange chick. How did you find her?
Delicious.
[after Miss Brunner absorbs Dr. Baxter]
Where's Baxter, then?
Oh, he's somewhere inside.
[last lines]
A very tasty world.
What are you going to do now?

Well, for a start, I'm going to sit here and get smashed out of my mind. And I also have it on very good authority that the world is coming to an end. I thought I'd go home and watch it on television.
Fuck off, you Greek maniac!
Now, I hate long goodbyes, so PISS OFF!
Well, that was all a bit... hmmmm...
